title: Effect of Heat Treatment Parameters on Microstructure and Mechanical Properties of Advanced High-Strength Steels
journal: Journal of Materials Engineering and Performance
abstract: This study investigates the influence of various heat treatment parameters on the microstructural evolution and mechanical properties of advanced high-strength steels for automotive applications. The results demonstrate that a carefully optimized intercritical annealing treatment can significantly enhance the balance between strength and ductility.

title: Surface Modification of Austenitic Stainless Steels for Enhanced Corrosion Resistance in Chloride-Containing Environments
abstract: This paper presents a novel surface modification technique for austenitic stainless steels that significantly improves corrosion resistance in aggressive chloride-containing environments. The treatment involves a combination of mechanical surface preparation and chemical passivation that results in a 40% improvement in pitting corrosion resistance.

title: Microstructure and Mechanical Properties of Additively Manufactured 316L Stainless Steel: Effect of Processing Parameters
journal: Proceedings of the Iranian Materials Science and Engineering Conference
abstract: This study examines the relationship between processing parameters in selective laser melting and the resulting microstructure and mechanical properties of 316L stainless steel components. Optimal processing parameters are identified that result in high density and improved mechanical performance.

title: Failure Analysis of High-Temperature Service Components in Petrochemical Industries
abstract: This paper presents a systematic approach to the failure analysis of high-temperature service components in petrochemical industries. Common failure mechanisms are identified, and preventive measures are proposed to extend component service life.

title: Optimization of Heat Treatment Parameters for Tool Steels Using Response Surface Methodology
journal: Iranian Journal of Materials Science and Engineering
abstract: This study employs response surface methodology to optimize heat treatment parameters for tool steels. The effects of austenitizing temperature, quenching medium, and tempering conditions on hardness, wear resistance, and toughness are investigated.
